reviews.sentence: Great time. Parking was not great at night but otherwise great. Staff is wonderful especially breakfast ladies.

Not what I expected for a Hampton Inn. Not what I expected for a Hampton Inn. Older hotel in need of updating. Room was very small and parking was very limited. There should be enough parking for at least one car per room. My husband spent 20 min. driving around the parking lot waiting for someone to leave. We were told there was additional parking by the liquor store but it did not look very safe.

Nice Hotel. Room was clean easy access to hotel. Nice and friendly staff. Would stay at this hotel again. Parking can be a challenge as the front lots were full. But lighting was good to park in back. Overall nice stay.

Hard nights sleep. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Location not so great a seedy liquor store is in the parking lot and the lighting is not great at night. The security guard was eating snacks and watching TV in the lobby so feeling really at ease and safe not so much. The Loby is updated but the luggage cart only one was rickety and broken at one end so our first impression were not fantastic. The room was on the very low end for a Hampton more like an older Holiday inn and the bed was really the Most uncomfortable of all the Hamptions we have stayed. It was so hard I had to lay on top of two pillows to sleep. I was up at 630 am bc my hip and side hurt after sleeping 4 hours that way. The breakfast is nice eggs and potatoes had too much seasoning but they had a fantastic selection and waffle station. The poorly furnished rooms and bed will be what keeps us from coming back. If you can sleep on a rock this is your place. The staff were the bright spot in it all.

Everything was great l have no complaints. Someone had mentioned about the parking and yes it was crowded with not alot of spaces but there was always parking beside this whit building on the other side of the hotel so no problem there and we were coming in around 12 to 1 am Friday and Saturday night. Breakfast area is pretty small but the manager open up another room for more people to enjoy there breakfast The rooms were clean so no problem there. No problem with the staff l really did nt have to say much to them only when checking in and still no problem. First time here l drove 75 hours to get here from North Carolina and l loved every bit of my stay thank you Hampton Inn.

Disappointed in Covington Hampton. Terrible location. Shares a nasty parking lot with a liquor store on what appears to be a dead end street although it is not. Certainly would not venture out in the evening without a crowd to walk with. Couch in the room was filthy would not consider sitting on it. Staff was very nice but was really disappointed in the quality Would never recommend this property to friends and family. Sell the property Hampton and move on.

Nice hotel. Room was nice. Room and hotel overall were very clean. Front desk was friendly and efficient. Breakfast was good. Coffee was great. The parking was the only thing I was not crazy about. I did find a spot when we returned about 11 pm but when I first came into the lot I was afraid I was not going to find a spot.

Way below Hilton standards. I often stay at Hampton Inns. This one was BY FAR the worst experience. Parking is dark and there is nt much of it. Rooms are seriously outdated. There is a sign at the front door saying they are remodeling so do nt expect to sleep past 8 am. No warning of this prior to reservation online. The Air Conditioner did not drop below 74 when set on 62. The breakfast was a standard Hampton Inn quality that i m used to. It was good and it was hot. If you need a drink to help tolerate your stay no wories there is a liquor store that appears to share the parking lot. We planned to stay two nights but checked out after one.

Good hotel sketchy neighborhood. The hotel was a standard Hampton Inn. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The biggest negative for me was the area. There were boarded up houses just across the street a liquor store and carry out in the same parking lot people standing on the street corner. the area was very sketchy. The front desk staff was very helpful. I forgot a fan to help my daughter and I sleep. The front desk promptly came to the rescue providing a fan from one of the back offices.

Parking is scarce at night. The room was extremely clean. Beds were super comfortable. it is next to two liquor stores and easy to find. The breakfast was good waffles eggs meats fresh fresh fruit cereal bagels Apple juice.

A MUST stay. property. WOW I was IMPRESSED. Not a big fan of BW but the Plus added to the brand caught my eye and allowed me to check it out. IMO everything was on point with an exception of Fitness room needs a circulation fan room TVs need to have a max volume control so that it will not be heard beyond the room and front desk staff should invest in NICE professional uniforms. I had 1 problem and the Assistant Manager did NOT handle it well. But it did not change my OVERALL feel of the hotel. my stay. Totally newly renovated property as of this year EXCELLENT breakfast free parking and about 4 minutes from downtown Cincinnati.

Very affordable and very clean hotel. We stayed here for a weekend long cheer competition. The hotel was amazingly clean had free parking and free breakfast and was only 15 miles away from Duke Energy Center where we needed to be. It was much cheaper than staying in downtown Cincinnati. I would stay here again for sure.
Great value. Excellent value for the area. Best place in Cinci area for Free parking WiFi breakfast. Friendly and accommodating staff easy access to city.

Excellent. Positives. Very clean. Spacious room. Location of hotel was fine easy to get to. Great breakfast. Easy and free outdoor parking. Friendly staff. Indoor pool was great. Cons. None really. I wish they had their own restaurant so we could have eaten there instead of having to go to one of the places close by. After a busy day and with kids it would have been much easier to get back to the hotel and eat dinner. Overall Excellent.

I shared a room with three other adult women. We felt the space was roomy thw beds were comfortable and the room was clean and well maintained. Parking was convenient the continenetal breakfat was delicious and the staff was friendly helpful and acomodating. I will highly recommend and return.
Pleasant accommodations parking a bit limited on a busy night.

Great People. Friendly courteous staff. Clean tastefully decorated Hotel with well lighted parking lots. The high speed interned worked flawlessly Conveniently located. Delicious breakfast I loved the new Fajita style eggs.
Great location and place. Great location for the greater Cincinnati area. Safe clean and plenty of parking. Reasonable rates. Highly recommend and would stay there again.

Close to downtown Cinci without the downtown price. I had a business meeting in downtown Cincinnati early in the morning so I looked for a hotel close to the location. Many hotels were close but charged 30 to park. This Best Western was just as close while not charging for parking and the cost was much less expensive. The room was very neat and bed was very comfortable. There were enough outlets on the desk without having to search for one. I asked for a quiet room and was given one at the end of the hall so I heard no noise and no one walking around at night. The breakfast has many options and the hot food was hot and cold food was cold. I would definitely stay here again when I have business in the area.

Clean and convenient to downtown locations. This hotel was very clean and modern and amenities were great. I will say that we were a little nervous when we pulled up as it was adjacent to a couple of liquor stores that had people milling about outside of them. It was about a 20 minute walk to the Great American Ballpark but we found that it was a pleasant walk and went along the Riverfront. Front desk was exceptionally helpful in giving directions and helping out with meal suggestions and parking for ball field. There is a shuttle that we opted not to take the walk was nice but probably farther than most people would want to walk. I do feel that the pricing was high compared to other hotels of this caliber.
